Serialized Form

  • Package <Unnamed>

    • Class ChatBotClient extends javax.swing.JFrame implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • chosenChannel

          boolean chosenChannel
          This boolean is false until the user has chosen a legitimate channel to enter.

        • userInput

          javax.swing.JTextField userInput
          This textfield becomes editable once the user connects to server. It is where the user types the messages they want to send to the other users.

        • outputText

          javax.swing.JTextArea outputText
          This JTextArea contains all the messages to the client. This includes if they are able to connect, messages they send, messages from other users, and messages from the server.

        • connection

          java.net.Socket connection
          This Socket is the one that connects to the server and provides the connection while the user is using the program

        • output

          java.io.ObjectOutputStream output
          This stream contains the output which the user wants to send to the server.

        • input

          java.io.ObjectInputStream input
          This stream contains any output by the server, and takes in those messages.

    • Class ChatBotServer extends javax.swing.JFrame implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • bot

          ChatBot bot
          This ChatBot is the chat bot that the users can interact with special commands in either of the channels. It has different responses based on what the user inputs.

        • executorService

          java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService executorService
          This ExecutorService is used to execute each of the client threads. Whenever a new client joins, a new thread is created.

        • sockServer

          ChatBotServer.SockServer[] sockServer
          This is an array of the private inner class, SockServer. Each SockServer is an instance of a client thread. This array contains each of the clients.

        • userChannel

          int[] userChannel
          This array is an integer array corresponding to the SockServer array. It contains either 0,1,2. If it is 0, then that client thread isn't opened. If it is 1, the client thread is running and the client is on channel 1. If it is 2, the client thread is running and the client is on channel 2.

        • totalUserConnections

          int totalUserConnections
          This int corresponds to the total amount of clients that are active and inactive across both channels

        • channel1Users

          int channel1Users
          This int corresponds to the total amount of clients that are active on channel one

        • channel1

          java.lang.StringBuilder channel1
          This StringBuilder contains all of the written messages that ever happened on channel 1

        • channel2

          java.lang.StringBuilder channel2
          This StringBuilder contains all of the written messages that ever happened on channel 2

        • userInput

          javax.swing.JTextField userInput
          This JTextField is editable, and allows the server to send messages to all of the clients

        • MAX_NUMBER_OF_CLIENTS

          int MAX_NUMBER_OF_CLIENTS
          This int is the total number of clients that can be opened on the server, 100 for this program

        • outputText

          javax.swing.JTextArea outputText
          This JTextArea contains all of the text that is relevant to the server when it is running.

        • server

          java.net.ServerSocket server
          This socket is what sets up the server for a client to connect to
